Posts.Content: Hello This is my first visit to this website that was recommended to me by a very good friend. I hope you guys can help me with my problem. I had a right lumpectomy in Apri '08. Everything went well, surgery, treatments(my treatment was new called mammosite--which they inserted a balloon cath in the hollow area of the breast area where the tissue was removed and went for radiation treatments 2 times a day for 5 days only), no chemo was suggested.  As I said all went well. Now, after almost a year I have having severe pain on the incision area so much that at times I cant move my right arm, it hurts alot when I cough or sneeze and the pain radiates to my chest at times.  I am unable to get out of bed in the mornings sometimes because of the pain. Has anyone else experienced this before and if so what have you done?
Posts.Title: Pain on incision area or breast????

Posts.Content: On 8/11/2009 LearnAbout_IPF wrote: I was really worried when after 3 years my mammo showed micro calcifications and a unusual mass that they couldn't resolve right over my scar from the lumpectomy.  Ended up with a 2nd surgical biopsy, had already made up my mind that they were both coming off if this was positive.  Turned out to be multiple cysts and radiation damage.  Wonderful relief.  The only thing is if you have surgery after radiation you can have a horrible time healing.  Took 7 months for a fistula in the cener of the new scar to heal.  I still have a hole the size of a pencil eraser that is healed but will never fill in.  Don't care much better than getting mets. So, how do I find out if its from radiation or something else?  Do I suggest to have another biopsy done to confirm or have an ultrasound?
Posts.Title: Confuse with dx

Posts.Content: I just returned from my 6 month mammo and was told by the radiologist that 2 microcalcifications were found, but nothing to worry about until I at least get 5 or more calcifications.  She also stated that these calcifications might have come from the radiation treatment I received last year.  I was very frustrated and have an appt with both the regular physician and my general surgeon next week.  I am strongly thinking of just having my right brest removed and have reconstructive surgery so that I wont have to worry about it for awhile.  I had a lumpectomy last year and only received radiation(call Mammosite, a new type of treatment which involved treatments of 2 times a day times 5 days only) then I was given a clearance.  That was last year, now supposedly I have to wait until I get 3 or more calcifications before anything can be done???  Can anyone out there give me any type of advise ?
